title: Theta Tau Alumni Panel
text:
Goal of the panel discussion

Expose the students various career paths in engineering and computer science.
Help students build professional contacts and network with \(\Theta T\) alumni.

title: Friday Engineering and Science Seminar Series (FRIES\(^3\))
text:
Goal of the lecture

Introduce the ideas behind the what is being called the Internet of Things from a historical context.
Demo: Use the deep_translator engine to do Speech processing
Demo: Use a social machine to control a physical entity
Automated email with any data such as text, audio files and images to selected attendees using the Raspberry Pi.

title: GWU ASME Section

The slide decks do not render on mobile devices with iOS. Use a laptop or a desktop to view the content.

title: GWU ASME Section
text:
Goal of the lecture

Expose the students to the history and current state of IoT technology
Make the students realize that they are either wearing, holding or carrying an IoT device
Demo: Provide a working IoT application using the Raspberry Pi and the senseHat module
Case discussion: How Domino’s Pizza reinvented their pizza story using IoT

title: Founder
text:
I am an Associate Research Professor in the Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering at The George Washington University, Washington DC. I am a generalist, working on things that interest me.
My formal training is in fluid dynamics. I am still passionately running experiments and doing some theoretical work in the field. Currently my fluid dynamics research is into biological fluid dynamics and cardiovascular flow.
I taught a cross-disciplinary course titled, Internet of Things (IoT) and Edge Computing. The course is extremely hands-on. It helped develop applications in cyber-physical systems and speech processing.
In addition, I taught courses for first year engineering students on the engineering applications of Raspberry Pi, Python programming and mobile App development inspired by social innovation potential during the COVID-19 pandemic.
I am here because of my experiences as a researcher, educator and immense support from family, friends and students.




  
Email: bulusu at email dot gwu dot edu
